newsitem.title: UK: BT dragged down by AT&T profit warning.
newsitem.headline: BT dragged down by AT&T profit warning.

text.p: Shares in British Telecom Plc fell in a rising market on Wednesday as investors took fright at a profits warning yesterday from U.S. telecoms giant AT&T.

BT shares dropped as low as 362p but recovered slightly to trade at 364p by 1231 GMT, down 3-1/2p on the day. Over seven million shares had changed hands. The FTSE 100 index was up 0.45 percent at the time.
"The AT&T profit warning discouraged investors. BT has a large stake in MCI, one of three core carriers in the U.S., so it's not too surprising BT came off too," one marketmaker said.

AT&T plunged on Wall Street overnight after it said competition in the key long-distance telephone market would likely result in profit shortfalls for the second half. The statement also dragged down MCI and Sprint.
Laurence Heyworth, analyst at Robert Fleming Securities in London played down the BT share's lacklustre performance, calling it a "knee-jerk reaction."
BT owns only 20 percent of MCI and called the holding relatively minor when compared to the group's overall capitalisation, Heyworth noted.
